job_title: Him Coding Specialist in Prescott, AZ
pros: The company as a whole is wonderful. Great benefits package and competitive salary. C-suite management seems to genuinely care about the staff and their wellbeing, which is refreshing.
cons: Consistent communication is not there. There seems to be a disconnect between management and employees sometimes. Lack of audits and interdepartmental procedures. Lack of accountability for some staff.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Prescott, AZ
pros: Wide variety of exams. Enjoyed coworkers. Helpful staff.
cons: Management takes advantage of the good workers. Maybe that’s everywhere. Don’t feel appreciated.

pros: Great pay and benefits here
cons: Get ready for the treadmill. Does not matter if patient needs your services, you just need to see them!

review_title: Good place to work and cares about patients
pros: Management cared both about their staff and good patient care
cons: Stressful at times due to busy schedule.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Prescott Valley, AZ
pros:
Good teamwork
Staff mostly have integrity and are generally good people
Management takes advice into consideration
cons: Sometimes no resource nurse and heavy assignments

pros: Feeling like you're part of a team. Cross-training in different areas
cons: Productivity goals are a bit much

pros: Good Pay, and decent hours.
cons:
Since YRMC is one of the few hospitals in town, it has a "corner on the market." What this means is yes, they are a good paying employer. The bad side is you end up selling your soul to maintain your lifestyle.  They are NOT Nurse friendly.... if you decide to advance your career, don't plan on any tuition reimbursement for graduate school, UNLESS you already have an "exempt" position. And once you have a graduate degree, they're not interested in Nurse Practitioners AT ALL. They never refer patients to NPs. 
They're Mission, Vision, and Values ONLY pertain to patients.... how they treat employees is another story. If they need to build a Breast Center, or Family Birthing Center rest assured it will be the employees that take the hit financially. There have been long term employees that have gone YEARS without a pay raises, and we're not talking nursing or administration.... yet the CEO is making a 7-figure income! Management is marginal, unless you're a bean-counter... it's all about the numbers!!!

job_title: Him Coding Specialist in Rimrock, AZ
pros: Small, rural hospital, two campuses, worked remote the last four years.  Lot of changes in management, but management now seems to be pleasing to my coder friends still there.  Compensation now more in line with National Standards.  I was lucky to get a facility job with just my CCA after completing my formal training via AHIMA.  Prescott is a beautiful city.
cons: Lack of a coder ladder "program."  Entered as a CCA, then in early 2012 passed my CCS, all as an ED coder.  Just no advancement at that time,  Coders hang on to their own areas of coding.  I chose to leave in order to grow, yet be careful - I had a really bad experience with an independent HIM company offering 30% more, and then had an accident, required two-level lumbar fusion.  Am fine now, on the  job hunt.  These are good people, yet not much (during my time at all) opportunity for moving up and growing.

pros: There was a good work/ life balance. The environment is friendly, and co-workers were easy to work with. Benefits are pretty good.
cons: The administration is out of touch with employees. They aren't very invested in lower level employees are offering any sort of professional education or training.

pros: The best reason to work at Yavapai Regional Medical Center is that the medical staff is some of the most knowledgeable in patient care that I have had the pleasure to work with.
cons: The American economy has caused necessary downsizing, which is causing some confusion.

pros: Most of the employees I work with are amazing helpful and fun to work with, it makes going to work easier knowing you've got wonderful coworkers to work with
cons: The only time management shows their face is if they need something from you, or you've done something wrong. Your emails don't get responded to and you can rarely get in touch with them.

review_title: Great pay and benefits,  heavy push for needless billing
job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Prescott, AZ
pros: Great pay, benefits, and nice people
cons: It's all about the money.  I was constantly pressured to pick up patients for treatment even if there was no benefit.  Often received referrals to my dept that were pointless.  It's a big merry go round of referring patients to more depts to generate revenue.

pros: I've worked for Yavapai regional Medical Center for over 20 years in various positions.  There are plenty of opportunities for advancement if desired.
cons: For me - the cons are that I would like to work part-time instead of full time and there are very few part-time positions available, particularly in my field.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Prescott, AZ
pros: Great working environment. Focus on teamwork. The nursing department places emphasis on "no pass rule" meaning all members of the department- nursing supervisor through CNA are expected to answer call lights.
cons: Pay is minimal for the number of responsibilities.

job_title: Unit Secretary in Prescott Valley, AZ
pros: Nice place to work.  Great doctors and nurses to spend 12 hrs a day.
cons: Wages are not very good. Maxed out for the last 7 yrs, going on 13 years of employment and no incentive to continue to work at YRMC EC .  Moving on soon.

job_title: Front Office/Floater/Medical Records Clerk in Riverside, CA
pros: I love the family atmosphere. Liked the doctors...Liked doing the varied jobs. Liked the comraderie with coworkers. Felt useful at helping people feel better about themselves.
cons: Not always able to get top management to follow through with promises for offices.
